intro: Psoralea acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-lobed psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Psoralea acuminata is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
